definition: to close (a door)/to eclipse/muddled/stupid/ignorant/variant of 暗[an4]

sentences.english: Can you guess which part of this post made me snicker a bit?
sentences.chinese: 你猜得出是这个职位的一部分，我暗笑一下？

sentences.english: I could hear him chuckling to himself as he read that funny article.
sentences.chinese: 当他阅读那篇有趣的文章时我能听到他在轻轻地暗笑。

sentences.english: He laughed a little to himself at his own foolishness.
While we snigger, referring to the side of her.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我们暗笑，指的是一边的她。

sentences.english: I couldn't help grinning when I think of the hundreds of posts that I will share with everyone here in the coming year.
sentences.chinese: 想到明年要跟大家分享的数百个小帖子，不禁暗笑。

sentences.english: With one hand now always locked onto the handrail, I bemoaned and laughed about my predicament a little more.
sentences.chinese: 一只手一直抓着栏杆，我边叹气边暗笑自己的推想。

sentences.english: The sunflower chuckled quietly, amused at the man's words.
sentences.chinese: 向日葵被他的话逗得咯咯暗笑。

definition: hidden smile/smirk/to rejoice covertly/secret satisfaction concerning one's evil plans
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to whine about hardships/to complain of one's bitter lot/to complain/to grumble
